short_description: This function gives score according to generalized linear model.
long_description: The GLMPredict function uses the model output by the function GLM to perform generalized linear model prediction on new input data. This function can be used with real-time applications. See AMLGenerator.

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the table containing the input data.
input_tables.description: Specifies the table containing the input data.

input_tables.name: model
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the table containing the model data.
input_tables.description: Specifies the table containing the model data.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of input table columns to copy to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the names of input table columns to copy to the output table.

argument_clauses.name: Family
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the distribution exponential family. The default value is read from model table. If you specify this argument, you must give it the same value that you used for the Family argument of the function  when you generated the model table.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the distribution exponential family. Note: If you specify this argument, you must give it the same value that you used for the Family argument of the function GLM when you created the model table. Default: Read from the model table

argument_clauses.name: LinkFunction
argument_clauses.rDescription: The default value is 'CANONICAL'. The canonical link functions (default link functions) and the link functions that are allowed for each exponential family Note: Use the same value that you used for the Link argument of the function  when you generated the model table.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the link function. For the canonical link functions (default link functions) and the link functions allowed for each exponential family, see Supported Family/Link Function Combinations. Note: If you specify this argument, you must give it the same value that you used for the LinkFunction argument of the function GLM when you created the model table. Default: 'CANONICAL'

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
